TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract ThreeDFormat

Docs.summary: Represents a shape's three-dimensional formatting.

remarks.para: Use the property to return a ThreeDFormat object.

You cannot apply three-dimensional formatting to some kinds of shapes, such as beveled shapes or multiple-disjoint paths. Most of the properties and methods of the ThreeDFormat object for such a shape will fail.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the Microsoft Word application.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float BevelBottomDepth { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Single that represents the depth of the bottom bevel. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float BevelBottomInset { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Single that represents the inset size for the bottom bevel. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoBevelType BevelBottomType { Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoBevelType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoBevelType value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant that represents the bevel type for the bottom bevel. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float BevelTopDepth { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Single that represents the depth of the top bevel. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float BevelTopInset { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Single that represents the inset size for the top bevel. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoBevelType BevelTopType { Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoBevelType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoBevelType value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant that represents the bevel type for the top bevel. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ContourColor As ColorFormat

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a object that represents color of the contour of a shape. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float ContourWidth { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Single that represents the width of the contour of a shape. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float Depth { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the depth of the shape's extrusion. Can be a value from – 600 through 9600 (positive values produce an extrusion whose front face is the original shape; negative values produce an extrusion whose back face is the original shape).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ExtrusionColor As ColorFormat

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the color of the shape's extrusion.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoExtrusionColorType ExtrusionColorType { Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoExtrusionColorType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoExtrusionColorType value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a value that indicates whether the extrusion color is based on the extruded shape's fill (the front face of the extrusion) and automatically changes when the shape's fill changes, or whether the extrusion color is independent of the shape's fill.

remarks.para: can be one of these MsoExtrusionColorType constants:
msoExtrusionColorAutomatic – Extrusion color based on shape fill.
msoExtrusionColorCustom – Extrusion color independent of shape fill.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float FieldOfView { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Single that represents the amount of perspective for a shape. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void IncrementRotationHorizontal([in]float32 Increment) runtime managed

Docs.summary: Horizontally rotates a shape on the x-axis using the specified incrementation value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void IncrementRotationVertical([in]float32 Increment) runtime managed

Docs.summary: Vertically rotates a shape on the y-axis using the specified incrementation value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void IncrementRotationX([in]float32 Increment) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required Single. Specifies how much (in degrees) the rotation of the shape around the x-axis is to be changed. Can be a value from –90 through 90. A positive value tilts the shape up; a negative value tilts it down.
Docs.summary: Changes the rotation of the specified shape around the x-axis by the specified number of degrees.

remarks.para: Use the property to set the absolute rotation of the shape around the x-axis.

You cannot adjust the rotation around the x-axis of the specified shape past the upper or lower limit for the RotationX property (90 degrees to –90 degrees). For example, if the RotationX property is initially set to 80 and you specify 40 for the argument, the resulting rotation will be 90 (the upper limit for the RotationX property) instead of 120.
To change the rotation of a shape around the y-axis, use the method. To change the rotation around the z-axis, use the method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void IncrementRotationY([in]float32 Increment) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required Single. Specifies how much (in degrees) the rotation of the shape around the y-axis is to be changed. Can be a value from – 90 through 90. A positive value tilts the shape to the left; a negative value tilts it to the right.
Docs.summary: Changes the rotation of the specified shape around the y-axis by the specified number of degrees.

remarks.para: Use the property to set the absolute rotation of the shape around the y-axis.
To change the rotation of a shape around the x-axis, use the method. To change the rotation around the z-axis, use the method.

You cannot adjust the rotation around the y-axis of the specified shape past the upper or lower limit for the RotationY property (90 degrees to – 90 degrees). For example, if the RotationY property is initially set to 80 and you specify 40 for the argument, the resulting rotation will be 90 (the upper limit for the RotationY property) instead of 120.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void IncrementRotationZ([in]float32 Increment) runtime managed

Docs.summary: Rotates a shape on the z-axis using the specified incrementation.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float LightAngle { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Single that represents angle of the lighting. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the parent object of the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState Perspective { Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState value); };

Docs.summary: MsoTrue if the extrusion appears in perspective— that is, if the walls of the extrusion narrow toward a vanishing point. MsoFalse if the extrusion is a parallel, or orthographic, projection— that is, if the walls don't narrow toward a vanishing point.

remarks.para: can be one of these MsoTriState constants:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PresetCamera As MsoPresetCamera
public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoPresetCamera PresetCamera { Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoPresetCamera get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an constant that represents the camera presets. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PresetExtrusionDirection As MsoPresetExtrusionDirection

Docs.summary: Returns the direction taken by the extrusion's sweep path leading away from the extruded shape (the front face of the extrusion).

remarks.para: can be one of these MsoPresetExtrusionDirection constants:
To set the value of this property, use the method.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoLightRigType PresetLighting { Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoLightRigType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoLightRigType value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant that represents the lighting preset. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoPresetLightingDirection PresetLightingDirection { Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoPresetLightingDirection get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoPresetLightingDirection value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the position of the light source relative to the extrusion.

remarks.para: can be one of these MsoPresetLightingDirection constants:
The lighting effects you set won't be apparent if the extrusion has a wire frame surface.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoPresetLightingSoftness PresetLightingSoftness { Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoPresetLightingSoftness get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoPresetLightingSoftness value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the intensity of the extrusion lighting.

remarks.para: can be one of these MsoPresetLightingSoftness constants:

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoPresetMaterial PresetMaterial { Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoPresetMaterial get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoPresetMaterial value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the extrusion surface material.

remarks.para: can be one of these MsoPresetMaterial constants:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PresetThreeDFormat As MsoPresetThreeDFormat

Docs.summary: Returns the preset extrusion format.

remarks.para: Each preset extrusion format contains a set of preset values for the various properties of the extrusion. If the extrusion has a custom format rather than a preset format, this property returns msoPresetThreeDFormatMixed.
can be one of these MsoPresetThreeDFormat constants:
The values for this property correspond to the options (numbered from left to right, top to bottom) displayed when you click the 3-D button on the Drawing toolbar.
Use the method to set the preset extrusion format.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState ProjectText { Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant that represents whether text on a shape rotates with shape. rotates the text. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ResetRotation() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Resets the extrusion rotation around the x-axis and the y-axis to 0 (zero) so that the front of the extrusion faces forward. This method doesn't reset the rotation around the z-axis.

remarks.para: To set the extrusion rotation around the x-axis and the y-axis to anything other than 0 (zero), use the and properties of the ThreeDFormat object. To set the extrusion rotation around the z-axis, use the property of the object that represents the extruded shape.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float RotationX { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the rotation of the extruded shape around the x-axis in degrees. Can be a value from – 90 through 90. A positive value indicates upward rotation; a negative value indicates downward rotation.

remarks.para: To set the rotation of the extruded shape around the y-axis, use the property of the ThreeDFormat object. To set the rotation of the extruded shape around the z-axis, use the property of the object. To change the direction of the extrusion's sweep path without rotating the front face of the extrusion, use the method.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float RotationY { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the rotation of the extruded shape around the y-axis, in degrees. Can be a value from – 90 through 90. A positive value indicates rotation to the left; a negative value indicates rotation to the right.

remarks.para: To set the rotation of the extruded shape around the x-axis, use the property of the ThreeDFormat object. To set the rotation of the extruded shape around the z-axis, use the property of the object. To change the direction of the extrusion's sweep path without rotating the front face of the extrusion, use the method.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float RotationZ { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Single that represents z-axis rotation of the camera. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetExtrusionDirection([in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoPresetExtrusionDirection PresetExtrusionDirection) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required .Can be one of these MsoPresetExtrusionDirection constants: msoExtrusionTop msoExtrusionTopRight msoExtrusionBottom msoExtrusionBottomLeft msoExtrusionBottomRight msoExtrusionLeft msoExtrusionNone msoExtrusionRight msoExtrusionTopLeft msoPresetExtrusionDirectionMixed
Docs.summary: Sets the direction that the extrusion's sweep path takes away from the extruded shape.

remarks.para: This method sets the property to the direction specified by the argument.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetPresetCamera([in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoPresetCamera PresetCamera) runtime managed

Docs.summary: Sets the camera presets for a shape.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetThreeDFormat([in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Core.MsoPresetThreeDFormat PresetThreeDFormat) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required . Specifies a preset extrusion format that corresponds to one of the options (numbered from left to right, top to bottom) displayed when you click the 3-D button on the Drawing toolbar.Can be one of these MsoPresetThreeDFormat constants. Note that specifying msoPresetThreeDFormatMixed for this argument causes an error. msoThreeD1 msoThreeD11 msoThreeD13 msoThreeD15 msoThreeD17 msoThreeD19 msoThreeD20 msoThreeD4 msoThreeD6 msoThreeD8 msoPresetThreeDFormatMixed msoThreeD10 msoThreeD12 msoThreeD14 msoThreeD16 msoThreeD18 msoThreeD2 msoThreeD3 msoThreeD5 msoThreeD7 msoThreeD9
Docs.summary: Sets the preset extrusion format. Each preset extrusion format contains a set of preset values for the various properties of the extrusion.

remarks.para: This method sets the property to the format specified by the argument.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState Visible { Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Core::MsoTriState value); };

Docs.summary: True if the specified object, or the formatting applied to it, is visible.

remarks.para: can be one of these MsoTriState constants:
Some methods and properties may be unavailable if the Visible property is False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float Z { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Single that represents the z-axis for the shape. Read/write.
